entry.title: SAP Business ByDesign 25.11 is now ready!
entry.content:
SAP Business ByDesign 25.11 is now ready!

SAP Business ByDesign 25.11 is now available and the SAP Business ByDesign What‚Äôs New blog gives you an overview about the most important new features of SAP Business ByDesign 25.11. These are the so called Focus Topics ( ).
For these Focus Topics, additional in-depth blogs and videos might be available - just click the link next to the Focus Topic in the What‚Äôs New blog.

To get an overview about all new features of SAP Business ByDesign in 25.11 please go to the What's New document.

Cross Topics

  • Informational Popup About Upcoming new Built-In Support Feature
    Customers are informed in advance about the upcoming Built-In Support (DSX) functionality and migration, reducing surprises and ensuring smooth adoption.
  • Bilingual EULA for ByDesign Mobile application
    A new bilingual End User License Agreement (EULA) in English and Chinese is now available for the SAP Business ByDesign mobile application. . 
  • Highlight Employee Responsible field is mandatory in Employee Task Distribution
    This enhancement improves usability and enhances the user experience by visually prompting users to complete mandatory fields before saving.
  • Attachment Extraction ‚Äì Self Service Feature
    A new self-service capability allows customers to extract tenant specific attachments from SAP Business ByDesign to SAP Managed SharePoint for selected business objects.
  • PSM release: APPLICATION_LOG Business Object fields
    Customer can now access and build custom PDI solution using APPLICATION_LOG Business Object in order to get details of a mass data run application log details like administrative data.
  • E-Customer Invoice Output Scenario: a new option to include PDF in initial release
    User now can enable an ‚ÄúE-Invoicing Include PDF‚Äù option in Output Settings for Customer Invoices. When selected, the system will attach a PDF file along with the XML output for e-invoicing.
  • Show Warning Prompt Before Locking a User
    When a user attempts to lock one or multiple users, the system now displays a confirmation prompt to ensure critical users (such as Admins) are not locked unintentionally.
For detailed information about What‚Äôs New in the Cross Topics area, please click here.

Customer Relationship 
Management

 

  • Merge Invoice Requests with Address Redetermination
    Customers can now get single invoice based on scoping done. This ensures that invoice splitting does not occur when Account Party and Payer Party Address for the same customer differ on Invoice Requests and a single invoice will be generated.
  • Upgrade to the SAP Business ByDesign Add-in for Microsoft Outlook Integration
    Upgraded version of Outlook Add-in from the Download Center can be downloaded which will secure the application from being exposed to  vulnerabilities. 
  • Enhancements to Service Order Web Service
    With this functionality, the fields Service Category and Incident Category would be populated directly though Web Service and no need to manually update on Service Order UI explicitly. 
  • New Data Source & Analytical Report to show Price Specification Count
    against each Sales Price List/Discount List‚ÄÉ
    The new Data Source "Sales Price/Discount List Item Count" (Data Source ID: CRMPRC_CNT) and the standard analytical report "Sales Price List with Specification Count" (Analytical Report ID: CRMPRC_CNT_REPORT) are now available in the Business Analytics Work Center. 
  • PSM Release of Fields and Associations in the Customer Quote
    Business Object
    In the Customer Quote business object, under the Covered Object Node, specified Fields (write-released) and Associations are now PSM released and customer can now access and build custom PDI solutions using these enabled fields and associations.
  • Enabling Value Conversion while processing Customer Contract Migration
    During the migration of customer contracts, the value conversion for the Employee Responsible and Contract Administrator fields is enabled. You can confirm values using the search help list.
For detailed information about What‚Äôs New in the Customer Relation. Management area, please click here.

Supplier Relationship 
Management

  • Enhancements to Supplier Invoice Data source
    Customer are now able to see the Payment Baseline date in the Supplier Invoice Reports.
  • Enhancements to Supplier Invoice Template Validation
    An Error message will get raised when try to delete supplier invoice template when it was referenced in unposted supplier invoices.
For detailed information about What‚Äôs New in the Supplier Relation. Management area, please click here.

Supply Chain 
Management

  • New Field (Stock Type description) in the Inventory Data Extraction Object
    A new column ‚ÄúStock Type Desc‚Äù is now available in the ‚ÄúInventory‚Äù data extraction Excel sheet which will contain the stock type description for the corresponding stock type code.
  • ItemID tag in the PO Excel Upload via iRPA for BOT Automated PO upload
    With this new BOT version, created Purchase order will now have item line number sequence correctly.
For detailed information about What‚Äôs New in the Supply Chain Management area, please click here.

Financial  
Management


  • Error Message for Clearing Documents in Closed Fiscal Year‚ÄÉ
    If the Posting Date of the original clearing document falls under a closed fiscal year, you cannot Reset Clearing document. The system will display an error message along with KBA.
  • Partner bank details in CAMT053 processing‚ÄÉ
    While processing the bank statement (CAMT53), the fields Bank Account Holder, IBAN and SWIFT/BIC  in the bank statement are updated in the Transaction Tab in the system.
  • Accounts Payable Balance Confirmation Process‚ÄÉ
    In the Accounts Payable (Supplier) Balance Confirmation Run, the Cut-off Date is now determined using the invoice document date instead of the Posting Date.
For detailed information about What‚Äôs New in the Financial Management area, please click here.

Legal and
Compliance

  • Austria
    Introduced New Version of ERV-JAB File 4.0
    The new JAB 4.0 will enable companies in Austria to create the year end reporting data in a structured XML data.
  • Germany
    New Taxonomy version and Associated Reporting Structures ‚Äì E-Bilanz
    The Excel template for taxonomy 6.8 and the latest build of SAP Business ByDesign E-Bilanz client are now available.
    EC Sales Tax Return
    The Country ID and VAT Registration have been merged into a single field with comma separation. 
    DTAZV format for foreign payment transactions
    The DTAZV format for foreign payment transactions (Auslandszahlungsverkehr, AZV) is being replaced by the ISO 20022 standard. 
  • Saint Lucia, Malaysia
    New Tax Number Type ‚Äì LC, MY
    Customer will be able to add this newly created tax number type for customer and supplier accounts.
  • Mexico
    Introduced New Tax Return to the A-29 Reports
    This  new A29 report will generate a flat file with 54 fields which will comply with the current legal changes which require enhanced data structure validation and more detailed reporting.
  • Netherland
    Introduced New Version 4.0.1 of NL Audit File
    This change will enable companies in Netherland to create the audit file financial systems with the new version (4.0) of the XSD provided by the tax office.
  • USA
    New  Withholding Tax Form 1099-MISC & 1099-NEC
    As per the IRS Instructions for Forms 1099-MISC and 1099-NEC, Excess Golden Parachute Payments can now be reported on Form 1099-MISC.
For detailed information about all country/region-specific features, please click here.

Solution Extensions

 

Take a look at the recently added partner soultions for SAP Business ByDesign in the SAP Store.

entry.title: Re: Serial number and Equipment number in Production Order
entry.content:
Hello @rahul_pande1 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at the following references for more details.

Serial Numbers in Sales and Distribution, Serial Number Management: FAQ, Equipment and Serial numbers,

Equipment

To summarise, in public cloud, the system automatically creates Equipment Numbers for serialised materials during MIGO or order confirmation. This is to enforce traceability between serial numbers and equipment masters.

If you need equipment to be created only by a 3rd-party system, you need to define a serialization profile where Equipment Record Required= Blank. Then use the MaterialDocument.Crated event and API_EQUIPMENT_SRV to create equipment externally after GR.

Please note that the public cloud‚Äôs clean-core approach hinders the direct suppressing of automatic equipment creation.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Keep Your Accounts Under Control with Domain Block and Temporary Account
entry.content:
Growing your presence as a supplier on SAP Business Network is a great opportunity, but it comes with a challenge: the uncontrolled multiplication of accounts, often created without the administrator‚Äôs awareness. The proliferation of accounts (ANID/BNOID) has been a longstanding pain point for suppliers, largely due to the wide range of activities covered by the network, from sourcing to supply chain collaboration. Here are a few strategies, including new features, you can use when ANID counts start to rise.

Hierarchy

The simplest option is to link your different accounts and organize them in a hierarchy, with one parent account and multiple child accounts. This offers several benefits:

  • Single sign-in access from the parent account
  • Visibility into all child accounts
  • Each account retains its own membership
  • Organize your accounts while still receiving individual invoices

This is particularly useful for companies with different cost centers. Establishing a hierarchy is also a prerequisite for requesting a Multi-Org, which consolidates billing for your chargeable accounts. This means you‚Äôll receive one quarterly inclusive invoice for all accounts, have one annual membership, and your relationship cap ($20,000) will apply across all accounts.

Domain Block

A good practice is to create user access for all team members likely to work on SAP Business Network, preventing them from creating new accounts for each customer request. However, this isn‚Äôt always feasible, especially in larger organizations.

The Domain Block feature, released in June 2025, allows the account administrator to claim available domains and configure governance for new account registrations, thereby controlling the proliferation of accounts. Once a domain is claimed, the settings can be configured per registration type as follows:

  • Walk-up registration: Block or Permit
  • Procurement-based registration (TRR and QE): Block, Permit, Permit Temporary
  • Sourcing and SLP Registrations: Permit, Permit Temporary (Blocking is not available due to the time-sensitive nature of these registrations.)

Temporary Account

Alongside Domain Block, the concept of a temporary account was introduced in June 2025. This allows for the creation of a limited standard account automatically linked to the ANID that claimed the domain. A temporary account:

  • Is not searchable by buyers
  • Is limited to one admin user, with no additional roles added
  • Is automatically linked to the account that owns the domain
  • Cannot upload a catalog
  • Does not have access to Promote & Discovery
  • Expires after 180 days (this time limitation has not yet been implemented)

A temporary account is not a new type of account. It is rather an enhancement to ensure that a new user on the supply side can participate in networked collaborations without being blocked, while preventing the multiplication of accounts and cluttering the search directory for buyers, as temporary accounts do not appear in search results.

 

These features help your organization control its footprint on the network and simplify how you can be found by new buyers. We hope these tips and tools support your strategy and governance in using SAP Business Network.

If you have more tips to share or any feedback on this article, please leave a comment below! For more documentation on setting up your supplier account, visit our SAP Business Network for Suppliers page on SAP Community.

entry.title: What's the transaction code to work with the hierarchy of functional areas?
entry.content:
In Accounting > Public Sector > Funds Management, there's the transaction code FM_FUNCTION to work with the functional areas.

But what's the transaction code to work with the HIERARCHY of functional areas?

Thanks

Sandra

entry.title: Re: What's the transaction code to work with the hierarch...
entry.content:
The transaction codes are:

  • FM_SETS_FUNCTION1 - Create
  • FM_SETS_FUNCTION2 - Change
  • FM_SETS_FUNCTION3 - Display

For information, the tables containing the hierarchy are SETHEADER, SETNODE and SETLEAF. But only the lines with SETCLASS = '0112' concern the functional areas.

entry.title: JOIN US: Meet SAP HANA Cloud @ SAP TechEd 2025
entry.content:
Hi there! If you care about turning data into real business advantage, this one‚Äôs for you. TechEd airs next Tuesday, and our SAP HANA Cloud track is built to spark ideas, answer your toughest database and AI questions, and get you hands-on with the tools you‚Äôll use tomorrow. Join us in Berlin or online! We‚Äôd love to meet you!

üîπ Why this matters to you

  • If you‚Äôre responsible for data strategy, cloud architecture, or AI-enabled apps, SAP HANA Cloud is a central part of SAP‚Äôs Business Technology Platform and Business Data Cloud.
  • Expect practical takeaways: built-in AI capabilities, vector search and knowledge graphs, elastic compute for scale, and patterns for keeping your S/4HANA core clean while innovating fast.
  • This is more than theory ‚Äî roadmap sessions and hands-on workshops show what‚Äôs coming in 2025 and beyond and how to apply it right away.

üîπ Meet the experts and join our sessions (onsite in Berlin ‚Äî quick guide)

  • ST115 ‚Äî Strategy Talk: ‚ÄúSAP HANA Cloud: The Database for Business AI‚Äù
    Nov 5, 2:15‚Äì2:40 PM CET
    A high-level look at how SAP HANA Cloud supports analytics, multi-model processing, ML and generative AI ‚Äî and where we‚Äôre going next.
  • DA817 ‚Äî Roadmap Session: ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs Next for SAP HANA Cloud: Roadmap and Innovation Highlights‚Äù
    Nov 6, 1:30‚Äì1:55 PM CET
    Roadmap reveals: generative AI toolkit, tabular AI functions, and features to connect your data to AI agents.
  • DA200 ‚Äî Deep Dive: ‚ÄúHelp future-proof your database landscape with SAP HANA Cloud"
    Nov 5, 10:15‚Äì11:00 AM CET
    Architecture-focused deep dive: elastic compute, file-based architectures, knowledge graphs, and integration patterns, to prepare your data landscape for the future.
  • DA201 ‚Äî Deep Dive: ‚ÄúAccelerating your AI strategy with SAP HANA Cloud‚Äù
    Nov 6, 9:00‚Äì9:45 AM CET
    How the In-Database AI, vector engine and knowledge graph engine enable context-rich AI scenarios via SAP HANA Cloud and SAP BTP.
  • DA202 ‚Äî Deep Dive: ‚ÄúExtensibility at scale: Building intelligent applications with SAP HANA Cloud‚Äù
    Nov 5, 1:15‚Äì2:00 PM CET
    Real-world approaches to clean-core extensibility using CAP and SAP Build Code.
  • DA261 ‚Äî Hands On: ‚ÄúUnlocking AI-driven insights from your business data in SAP HANA Cloud‚Äù
    Nov 4, 12:30‚Äì2:30 PM CET
    Hands-on focussing on working with tabular AI, similarity search, and RAG using the knowledge graph engine.
  • DA263 ‚Äî Hands On: ‚ÄúSAP HANA Cloud: Advisors and Automation‚Äù
    Nov 6, 9:00‚Äì11:00 AM CET
    Try advisors and automation features (ECN provisioning, partition/index advisors) that reduce ops overhead.
  • DA262 ‚Äî Hands On: ‚ÄúEnabling clean core development with SAP HANA Cloud and SAP Build Code‚Äù
    Nov 5, 3:30‚Äì5:30 PM CET
    Build side-by-side extensions with SAP HANA Cloud + CAP + SAP Build Code ‚Äî fast, scalable, and safe.

üîπ Tune in for our virtual sessions

  • ST115v ‚Äî Strategy Talk: ‚ÄúSAP HANA Cloud: The Database for Business AI‚Äù
    Nov 5, 6:30 - 6:55 PM CET
    A high-level look at how SAP HANA Cloud supports analytics, multi-model processing, ML and generative AI ‚Äî and where we‚Äôre going next.
  • DA817v ‚Äî Roadmap Session: ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs Next for SAP HANA Cloud: Roadmap and Innovation Highlights‚Äù
    Nov 6, 1:30‚Äì1:55 PM CET
    Roadmap reveals: generative AI toolkit, tabular AI functions, and features to connect your data to AI agents.
  • DA201v ‚Äî Deep Dive: ‚ÄúAccelerating your AI strategy with SAP HANA Cloud‚Äù
    Nov 6, 9:00‚Äì9:45 AM CET
    How the In-Database AI, vector engine and knowledge graph engine enable context-rich AI scenarios via SAP HANA Cloud and SAP BTP.

üîπ Who you‚Äôll meet

Our speakers include engineers and product experts from the SAP HANA Cloud team, the people designing the roadmap and building the features you‚Äôll use. Bring your toughest questions; these sessions are designed for real dialogue and practical guidance.

Curious now? A few questions you‚Äôll leave with answers to:

  • How can genAI, knowledge graphs and agents change app behavior and search across enterprise data?
  • What does a vector & knowledge graph engine enable for RAG-style assistants?
  • How can elastic compute and automation lower costs and simplify scaling?
  • What are the best patterns to extend SAP apps without touching the core?

üîπ Onsite or virtual ‚Äî your choice

TechEd supports both formats. If you‚Äôre in Berlin, come meet the team in person, network, ask questions, and join hands-on sessions. If you‚Äôre remote, register for the virtual stream and get the same deep content and access to speakers.

üîπ Next steps

Register now on the SAP TechEd registration page and add the SAP HANA Cloud sessions to your agenda.
If you want a hands-on slot, sign up early! Those sessions fill up fast.

entry.title: Re: 2H2025 - LRN-152573 - Upcoming course units in the ad...
entry.content:
The calendar view was never designed to be apart of the new learning library search but was only apart of the legacy experience and mentioned in KBA https://me.sap.com/notes/359142.  The default behavior is similar to the non-calendar option in legacy where you click on the item to view available classes.  This enhancement was to allow for the classes to be shown directly in the library search for similar comparisons of upcoming classes by start date, region, and facility against most needs and keeping the design consistent.
  Based on Customer Community Idea 325775: The legacy calendar view is not on our roadmap. If this new experience doesn‚Äôt meet your business needs, please open an influence ticket so we can assess and prioritize it.

entry.title: How to extract BOM Explosion and Configuration details for Sales Order Items into SAP Datasphere
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

We are currently working on exporting BOM explosion data for Sales Order items into SAP Datasphere.

Our goal is to replicate the same level of detail available in transaction VA03 (Display Sales Order) ‚Äî specifically when selecting an item, navigating to Item Details ‚Üí Configuration, and choosing "Bill of Material" as the configurable item.

We have verified that there are no released or available CDS Views in S4HANA Public Cloud covering the standard SAP tables required to replicate this logic, such as:

  • CUOB ‚Äì Assignment of Object to Dependency

  • CUKN ‚Äì Dependency Storage (Variants/Configuration)

  • IBIN ‚Äì IBase Components ‚Äì Condition

  • IBINVALUES ‚Äì IBase Components ‚Äì Condition Characteristic Evaluation

  • IBSYMBOL ‚Äì Characteristic Value Assignment

  • CABN ‚Äì Characteristic

We also explored the Sales Order ‚Äì Simulate (A2X) API as a potential source, since it exposes variant configuration details through the _VariantConfiguration/_Instance association.
However, when trying to consume this API in SAP Datasphere, that association and its detailed data are not accessible.

Our questions:

  1. How can we import these specific configuration / BOM explosion details into SAP Datasphere?

  2. Are there any other APIs or CDS Views providing access to this data?

  3. Is there any recommended approach or best practice to achieve this kind of replication?

Any insight, workaround, or experience with similar requirements would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks in advance for your help

entry.title: SAP MaxAttention Innovation Workshop 'Integrated Toolchain' (Virtual, November 19, 2025)
entry.content:
Virtual

November 19, 2025

Agenda

Dear Valued Customers,

We are pleased to invite you to the SAP MaxAttention Innovation Workshop ‚ÄúIntegrated Toolchain‚Äù taking place virtually on 19th November 2025.  Please find the agenda of workshop here.

With the introduction of the RISE with SAP methodology, the Integrated Tool Chain and related transformation tools and services have become key enablers within the SAP Cloud ERP portfolio.  The Integrated Tool Chain is designed to orchestrate every phase of a business and IT transformation‚Äîbringing together the strengths of SAP Signavio, SAP LeanIX, SAP Cloud ALM, and SAP WalkMe into a seamless end-to-end journey. Built on a collaborative methodology, it ensures alignment between business and IT stakeholders‚Äîenabling organizations to realize value faster, from the initial discovery phase through to continuous improvement after go-live. During this workshop, we will explore the capabilities of these tools and showcase a live demo illustrating how SAP‚Äôs Integrated Tool Chain helps define, map, and execute transformation activities ultimately accelerating the customer‚Äôs transformation journey.

Our Workshops

These sessions and workshop series focus on a specific topic and the purpose is to enable our customers to understand the product portfolio and innovative technologies of SAP in order to drive adoption and consumption. As specifically now, it is more important than ever to help companies to be successful and to respond to changing markets by transforming into intelligent enterprises in the experience economy.

Important

Please note that the 'Attend' button which can be found within this blog post does not serve as a formal registration for the event.

To officially register, please reach out to me, paul.schropp@sap.com and I will ensure that your registration is properly processed.

We look forward to having you join us for our upcoming events and thank you for your understanding!

Your feedback

Feel free to share your feedback and thoughts in the comment section below.

entry.title: Supply Chain Planning Reimagined: Charting the Path to Decision-Centric, Autonomous Planning
entry.content:
For decades, supply chain leaders have been on a relentless quest for greater efficiency. We've built global networks, mastered lean inventory, and embraced automation at breakneck speeds. But the last few years have upended comfortable certainties. Geopolitical upheaval, pandemic ripple effects, and climate-related disruptions have rewritten the rules‚Äîturning volatility into the new normal. Today, planning is no longer a periodic exercise; it‚Äôs a dynamic, always-on process at the heart of business resilience and agility.

To empower confident and resilient planning companies need to synchronize decision-making across end-to-end supply chains, and drive sustainable value through data science, AI-powered insights, and transformative, outcomes-centric processes.

The Challenge: Confronting Complexity and Persistent Change

Supply chain leaders face an environment defined by persistent uncertainty. Plans must change not by quarter or by month‚Äîbut sometimes by hour. Yet too many organizations are still hampered by legacy silos and fragmented tools, resulting in disjointed planning, slow decision cycles, and out-of-date data. The pressure to keep peace and indeed to anticipate disruption has never been greater.

The journey from data to action is often bogged down in manual handoffs, conflicting KPIs, and limited scenario planning, limiting the impact of even the best talent and intentions.

The Vision: Decision-Centric, Autonomous Planning

The future belongs to forward-thinking leaders who embrace a new model: decision-centric, autonomous supply chain planning.

But what does this mean in practice?

  • Integrated Decision-Centric Planning to achieve resilient and optimized mid to long-range plans with an AI-powered planning platform. This enables companies to seamlessly collaborate across supply chain, commercial, and finance teams to deliver financially smart scenario plans and adapt to market shifts with confidence.
  • Autonomous Planning and Decision Making by accelerating operational agility across the business network to enhance decision-making across the entire supply chain.
  • Post Planning Decision Intelligence and Actioning to enable cross-functional planning and real-time decisions by tracking plan-to-execution against KPIs, and enabling continuous corrective actions for enhanced agility across your value chain.
  • Convergence of supply chain silos by Integrating real-time data, synchronizing production and scheduling, and collaborating across the network to enhance agility, optimize resources, and improve customer satisfaction.
  • Unified Planner Experience through streamlined planning views for supply chain leaders and decision makers.
  • Put people at the Center to enable a human-centric supply chain that transforms your operations by autonomously executing routine tasks to free up people to focus on high-value activities.

    By connecting these capabilities, companies can create a unified workspace designed with planners in mind to anticipating risk, managing by exception, and relentlessly driving better outcomes.

    Delivering Tangible Value: The Autonomous Advantage

    What does this look like in measurable business impact?

    SAP‚Äôs advanced planning platform is driving real results for companies worldwide:

    • Up to 24% improved forecast accuracy and up to 82% lower revenue loss due to stockouts by unifying data and automating demand sensing.
    • 4‚Äì20% improvement in on-time, in-full delivery, boosting customer satisfaction and loyalty.
    • Optimized working capital through smarter inventory placement and risk-aware scenario planning.
    • Faster planning cycles so that teams that once updated plans weekly can now adapt in near real-time, reallocating resources in minutes rather than days.
    • Actionable alerts and ‚Äúguided‚Äù user experiences allowing supply chain teams to focus on the deviations that matter, rather than drowning in data noise.

      Critically, this approach enables organizations not just to react faster, but to leap ahead, and to turn their supply chain from a cost center into a competitive differentiator.

      Cultivating a Culture of Continuous Improvement

      Adopting decision-centric, autonomous planning is more than a technology upgrade. It requires a fundamental shift in mindset: from reactive firefighting to proactive, empowered problem-solving.

      The most successful teams are those that embrace change, foster collaboration, and encourage learning at every level.

      At SAP, we strive to be a trusted partner on this journey, providing not just technology, but proven business templates, industry best practices, and a collaborative ecosystem. Our mission is to help planners and decision-makers become architects of resilience and agents of innovation in their organizations.

      Charting the Path Forward

      In today‚Äôs landscape, the only constant is change, and the urgency for more agile, intelligent supply chains is undeniable. The winners of tomorrow will be those who act today to unlock new levels of confidence, speed, and value creation through decision-centric, autonomous planning.

      Whether you‚Äôre a seasoned supply chain executive or rising operations leader, now is the time to ask:

      • Are your planning processes set up not just for efficiency, but for resilience and continuous transformation?
      • Are your teams empowered to make decisions at the speed of business‚Äîor held back by legacy limitations?

        At SAP, our promise is to help you reimagine what supply chain planning can achieve: empowering your talent, unleashing innovation, and turning complexity into your greatest advantage.

        To learn more, listen to a recent Future of Supply Chain podcast with SAP Supply Chain Planning, Chief Product Officer SP van Houten - Episode 131: Supply Chain Planning Re-imagined with SAP‚Äôs SP van Houten

entry.title: A Story of Innovation - From Local Beginnings to Global Intelligence with AI-Assisted Insights
entry.content:
How SAP‚Äôs Global Business Partner Certificate Management Solution Transforms Compliance

Across industries and regions, businesses face a common challenge ‚Äî managing partner certificates efficiently while meeting strict regulatory requirements.

Different countries enforce unique rules, formats, and audit practices, making it difficult for organizations to stay compliant while operating globally.

Recognizing this growing complexity, SAP teams set out to transform certificate management from a manual, country-specific task into a unified, intelligent global process ‚Äî leading to the creation of the Global Business Partner Certificate Management solution.

A New Chapter for SAP Customers and Partners

This week, SAP hosted a global webinar to introduce this innovation to customers and partners worldwide.
The session brought together SAP experts and business leaders from multiple regions to explore how this new capability helps organizations ensure compliance, simplify operations, and harness AI for smarter insights.

The Business Partner Certificate Management solution empowers SAP S/4HANA customers to centrally maintain and monitor certificates for both suppliers and customers, addressing the end-to-end lifecycle of compliance documentation.

The goal is simple ‚Äî make compliance intelligent, reducing risk and manual effort while enabling businesses to operate seamlessly across borders.

From Regional Beginnings to Global Availability

The journey began with the Supplier Certificate Management solution, first introduced in selected countries across the MENA region and India to manage supplier legal certificates.

Encouraged by strong adoption, customers soon asked a pivotal question:

That feedback sparked a transformation. SAP extended the concept to cover both suppliers and customers, delivering a more comprehensive Business Partner Certificate Management solution that is now available globally across SAP S/4HANA (On-Premise and Private Cloud Edition) ‚Äî with expansion to Public Cloud on the horizon.

Unifying Compliance with Intelligence

The new solution provides a centralized, structured, and auditable way to manage certificates directly within the Business Partner master data.

It supports full lifecycle management ‚Äî including exemptions, extensions, renewals, restorations, and deletions ‚Äî all within SAP S/4HANA.
This ensures that every business partner record remains compliant, current, and ready for audit.

Empowered by SAP Joule

To make the experience even smarter, the solution now integrates with SAP Joule, the AI copilot that delivers AI-assisted insights into certificate management.

Co-Innovation and Customer Feedback
